title.narrative: 506 IPS HAVE INCREASED CAPACITY TO PROVIDE CONTINUED ACCESS TO EDUCATION

description.narrative: Government and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to education , especially for the most vulnerable population, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Business and Key Business Stakeholders demonstrate growing willingness, commitment and resource allocation for protecting and promoting child rights in policy and practice by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to education , especially for the most vulnerable population

description.narrative: UNICEF India provides technical support to national and state governments and partners in the continuity of learning at home reaching to around 38 million children(49.7% girls) in 17 states. Continued support is being provided in development of digital content for broadcasting educational lessons through TV, radio and other digital mediums. Multiple pathways and outreach strategies are being developed to improve access and use of learning materials by students, especially in reaching the unreached, with the support of teachers,parents, academic coordinators and volunteers. | Status: | As-of Date:
